alert.note: Alert for Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 13 at 6:25PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Warren, southeastern Monroe and Northampton Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 624 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Old Orchard, or over Easton, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Easton, Bethlehem, Forks, Wilson, Nazareth, Bangor, Pen Argyl, Wind Gap, Belvidere, Harmony, Oxford, Alpha, Belfast, West Easton, Tatamy, East Bangor, Riegelsville, Steuben, Glendon and Stormville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 70 and 76. Interstate 78 in New Jersey between mile markers 0 and 5. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
